byline.contributor: Ruth Bashinsky and Nate Schweber contributed reporting.

abstract: Donald Maloney, tugboat captain who died in frigid waters off Long Island when his vessel sank, hailed from family long associated with tugboats; died attempting to save his vessel, which took on water for unclear reasons and sank within minutes; those close to him say his death was devastating, but not shocking, given nature of tug work.
lead_paragraph: Donald Maloney, 60, who hailed from a family of New York mariners, died when his vessel, the Sea Bear, sank along the South Shore of Long Island.

headline.main: For Tug Captain, Job That Runs in Family Turns Deadly Off Long Island
headline.print_headline: For Veteran Tug Captain, a Job That Runs in the Family Turns Deadly

snippet: Donald Maloney, 60, who hailed from a family of New York mariners, died when his vessel, the Sea Bear, sank along the South Shore of Long Island.
